intro: Hieracium camptopetalum, commonly known as the bent-petalled hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragweed, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, bent petal structure. Hieracium camptopetalum is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-poor soils.
